summary: An internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) regarding ABC News reporting on an Epstein cooperator. The email is marked as high importance and discusses media coverage of the case.

persons.name: Dawn Dearden
persons.context: Sender of the internal email regarding ABC News reporting on an Epstein cooperator.

persons.name: Nicholas Biase
persons.context: Recipient (cc'd) on the internal email about media reporting.

persons.name: James Margolin
persons.context: Recipient (cc'd) on the internal email about media reporting.

connections.description: Internal email correspondence within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY.
Internal email correspondence within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY.

events.title: Internal SDNY email on Epstein cooperator report
events.description: An internal email is sent within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY regarding ABC News reporting on an Epstein cooperator.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The email is dated August 6, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and death.
The subject is 'Epstein cooperator', indicating discussions about someone cooperating with authorities.
ABC News is reported to feel confident enough to report on the cooperator, showing active media interest.
The email is marked as 'High' importance, signaling its significance within the prosecutor's office.
The correspondence is internal to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, which was handling the Epstein case.
